0.text: The night is darkest just before the dawn. Keep going, the light will come.
0.author: Thomas Fuller

1.text: Dreams are the seedlings of realities. Nurture them through the night.
1.author: James Allen

2.text: The darkest hour has only sixty minutes.
2.author: Morris Mandel

3.text: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
3.author: Earl Nightingale

4.text: The stars are symbolic of the fact that even in darkness, there is light.
4.author: Anonymous

5.text: Wake up with determination, go to bed with satisfaction.
5.author: Anonymous

6.text: Morning is an important time of day, because how you spend your morning can often tell you what kind of day you are going to have.
6.author: Lemony Snicket

7.text: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive â€“ to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
7.author: Marcus Aurelius

8.text: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
8.author: Plato

9.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
9.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

10.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
10.author: Winston Churchill

11.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
11.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

12.text: Opportunities don't happen. You create them.
12.author: Chris Grosser

13.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
13.author: Sam Levenson

14.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
14.author: Walt Disney

15.text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
15.author: Steve Jobs

16.text: The harder you work for something, the greater you'll feel when you achieve it.
16.author: Anonymous

17.text: The sunset is a reminder that everything beautiful disappears, but will come again when the time is right.
17.author: Anonymous

18.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
18.author: Nelson Mandela

19.text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
19.author: Abraham Lincoln

20.text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
20.author: John Lennon

21.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
21.author: Dalai Lama

22.text: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
22.author: Thomas A. Edison

23.text: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
23.author: Brian Tracy
